conclusion: To determine the work done by the gas from state A to state B, we can follow these steps:
The process from state A to state B is an isobaric expansion (constant pressure).
From the graph, the pressure at state A and B is constant at \( p = 1 \times 10^5 \) Pa.
The volume changes from \( V_A = 3 \) L to \( V_B = 4 \) L.

premise: The work done by the gas during an isobaric process is given by: \nW = p \Delta V
conclusion: The work done is calculated using the formula \( W = p \Delta V \).

premise: Here, \( \Delta V = V_B - V_A = 4 \text{ L} - 3 \text{ L} = 1 \text{ L} \).
conclusion: The change in volume \( \Delta V = 1 \text{ L} \).

premise: Convert the volume from liters to cubic meters (since \( 1 \text{ L} = 0.001 \text{ m}^3 \)): \n\Delta V = 1 \text{ L} = 0.001 \text{ m}^3
conclusion: The change in volume in cubic meters is \( \Delta V = 0.001 \text{ m}^3 \).
